abstract: Carl C. Icahn is considering a proxy fight for seats on Yahoo’s board in hopes of pushing the company to restart talks to sell itself to Microsoft.
snippet: Carl C. Icahn is considering a proxy fight for seats on Yahoo’s board in hopes of pushing the company to restart talks to sell itself to Microsoft.
lead_paragraph: The Microsoft-Yahoo merger story may not be over yet.

headline.main: Icahn Is Said to Weigh a Proxy Fight at Yahoo
headline.print_headline: Icahn Is Said to Weigh a Proxy Fight at Yahoo

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Miguel Helft

abstract: As news surfaced that Carl C. Icahn may go on the warpath at Yahoo, questions turned to what kind of support the billionaire investor and activist shareholder could expect — both from Microsoft and Yahoo shareholders alike.
lead_paragraph: As news surfaced that Carl C. Icahn may go on the warpath at Yahoo, questions turned to what kind of support the billionaire investor and activist shareholder could expect — both from Microsoft and Yahoo shareholders alike.

headline.main: Will Yahoo Shareholders Get Behind Icahn?
